area.key: uSync.Publisher allows you to link your Umbraco sites so you can push and pull content, media and other settings between them.
It looks like everything is already in sync between these servers, so you do need to do anything.
Checkout the Security setup guide to harden your setup.
This server will listen and respond to requests from other servers
Allow publish / pull requests to be made from this server
Setting up a secure channel between servers

Each server will need to communicate using a secuire AppId and Key. These keys are stored in the uSync.Publish.Config file. You should ensure each server has the correct keys installed in this file.

If these values are blank in the config, then uSync.Publisher will create new keys at startup, but the keys will still need to be the same on all servers.
This is the server URL; you will need this to connect other Umbraco instances to this site
Copy this URL and use it in the server URL on your other installations
Default publishing options when not overridden by server settings
Choose where to pull content from
Items that will be imported to this site
Changes that will be made on the site
include the children of this item
Remove any items on the target site that are not in this folder
Include media items used in these pages
Include content pages linked to from selected items

The following settings can result in a large amount of extra content or media being sent during a publish

Most of the time you won't want a user to select these settings.
Include the parents of selected items
Include settings for these pages, inc. doctypes and datatypes
Include required templates, stylesheets and scripts
Users have to be members of these groups to push or pull items
Visible servers are controlled via a list for each server, sharing a single config for all.

Server mode (default)

In server mode the configuration of what can be pushed/pulled is setup against each server in the individual server's config file

Network mode

In network mode configuration is based a list of 'visible servers' that is stored in each servers section of the config file. This means a single config file can be shared between all servers without the need of transforms.

More information
List of servers that you can push/pull from while on this server (N.B this UI config, not security!)
Drag the different items up or down below to set how they should be arranged
There are no servers to sort

Push the server settings between sites.

Settings can be included when you push and pull content, but only the required settings will be pushed that way.

If you want to push settings irrespective of their use in content, you can do that here

Here you can also push settings that may not be included in a content publish, such as hostnames and Public Access settings
Including media when syncing a large content tree can make things go slower. Consider syncing the media from the media section and then syncing the content tree.

The current page has changes that have not been saved or published. Any changes you now push to another server will not include these changes. You should Save and Publish this page first before sending to another site.
Push content to other Umbraco sites/servers
Pull content from other Umbraco sites/servers
Add 'Publish to Server' option in the stardard Save and Publish button
